title: What artificial intelligence systems almost seem to have achieved consciousness, even if they actually haven't? - Quora

response.answer_text: There is Sophia that can carry on a conversation with semi-appropriate facial expressions. At first it seems that you are dealing with a conscious entity but after a while Sophia seems to run out of steam and answers become repetitive, off subject or just weird. However, she is improving at a pretty swift pace but much appears to be canned.

None. Results vary based on the individual’s depth understanding of what consciousness is. Consciousness is defined by the proper design not outward effects. If the design isn’t correct, its not consciousness. No such design exists. Most systems are essentially statistical optimization engines.
